info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 06 at 9:51PM EST until January 07 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. Storm total of 6 to 12 inches expected, with the lower end amounts in the Wyoming Valley. * WHERE...Bradford, Susquehanna, Northern Wayne, Wyoming, Lackawanna, Luzerne, Pike and Southern Wayne counties. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snow will be east of I-81 over the next several hours. Snowfall rates of 2 to 3 inches per hour will be possible until around or just after midnight. Then a lull overnight, with more light to moderate snow on Sunday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission strongly encourage motorist to heed all travel restrictions and delay unnecessary travel. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadways, and traffic conditions.
